label: AB_hP12_186_a2b_a2b-001
title: Moissanite-6H SiC ($B6$) Structure
comments:
This is an alternate stacking (ABCACB) for tetrahedral structures. Compare this to \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_216_a_c-001}{zincblende ($B3$, ABCABC)}, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hP8_186_ab_ab-001}{moissanite-4H ($B5$, ABAC)}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_hP4_186_b_b-001}{wurtzite ($B4$, ABABAB)}. 
 The 6H refers to the fact that there are 6 CSi dimers in a hexagonal unit cell. Zincblende is denoted 3C, and wurtzite is 2H. 
 Without loss of generality, we can take any of the $z_{i}$ to be zero. Here we take $z_{2} = 0$ for the silicon (2a) site. 
 The ICSD entry is from the later work of (Capitani, 2007).
